## Conversation that answers the provided question:
**User:**
I'm trying to get a better understanding of the Verus network. How can I retrieve information about connected peers on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
You can retrieve information about connected peers on the Verus network using the `getpeerinfo` command. This can be done in two ways: using the Verus command-line interface or by sending a JSON-RPC request.

If you want to use the command-line interface, you can simply run:
```
verus getpeerinfo
```
Alternatively, you can send a JSON-RPC request like this:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpeerinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Either of these methods will give you the information you need about connected peers on the Verus network. Do you have any other questions about this or anything else related to Verus?
How can I retrieve information about connected peers on the Verus network?

You can retrieve information about connected peers on the Verus network using the `getpeerinfo` command. This can be done in two ways: using the Verus command-line interface or by sending a JSON-RPC request.

Using the Verus command-line interface:
```
verus getpeerinfo
```

Using JSON-RPC:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpeerinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

Examples:
> verus getpeerinfo 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpeerinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
